特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: This course will be offered on-demand until April 28. After the registration is finalized, we will inform you of the course format after 5/1.

第3回:
Bakumatsu: The End of the Shogunate

On-demand Implementation
第4回:
Read Jansen, pp. 338, 364; Irie, Foreword, Chapter 1.
Refer Jansen pp. 333 - 370; 入江, まえがき, 第一章.
第5回: From Prey to Predator: Japan Joins the Imperialist System

Read Jansen, pp. 395 - 400; Irie, Chapter 2
Refer: 入江, 第ニ章
第6回:
Read Jansen, pp. 437 - 455;
Iriye, Chapter 3
Refer: 入江, 第三章
第7回: The First World War and Continental Expansion

Read Jansen, pp. 511 - 528;
Iriye, Chapter 4
Refer: 入江, 第四章
第8回: Shidehara Diplomacy: Liberalism and its Discontents

Read Iriye, Chapter 5
Refer: 入江, 第五章
第9回: The Manchurian Incident and Military Ascendancy
第10回:
Read: Iriye, Chapter 6
Refer: 入江, 第六章
第11回: The Marco Polo Bridge Incident and the Chinese Quagmire
第13回:
Read: Jansen, pp. 625 - 666; Iriye, Chapter 7
Refer: Refer: 入江, 第七章
トピック.授業外学習2: As a general rule, students will be expected to spend one to two minutes of time outside class preparing for every minute of class time.

評価.教科書Required texts0:
Marius B. Jansen, "The Making of Modern Japan," (Harvard University Press, 2000), ISBN: 0-674-00991-6
Akira Iriye, "Japan and the Wider World," (Routledge, 1997), ISBN: 978-0582210530
評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
This course will help students to understand and analyze problems in international relations, particularly those that deal with those of people from different regions and cultures. In addition, it will help them to develop their powers of autonomous learning by giving them the skills to identify the sorts of problems that require investigation.

各授業科目は、各学部・研究科の定めるディプロマ・ポリシー（DP）・カリキュラム・ポリシー（CP）に基づき、カリキュラム上に配置されています。
DP・CPを意識して本授業科目の学修を進めることで、各学部・研究科の期待する能力が養成されます。
各学部・研究科のDP、CPや教育課程表（授業科目一覧等）は、下記リンクこちらに掲載していますので学修計画の参考にしてください。
https://kwic.kwansei.ac.jp/cabinet/reference?typeCd=0&cabinetId=557&directLink=1

成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
評価.成績評価Grading4:
備考　Note
Students will be expected to participate in class discussions and may be asked to complete small assignments from time to time. These will all factor into the participation grade which is twenty-five percent of the final grade. There were also be two written assignments which will count as twenty percent of the grade for each assignment. Finally, there will be a final exam worth thirty-five percent of the grade. Alternatively, if students so desire, they may choose to submit a term paper in place of the final exam.

name: 【380】Prewar Japanese Diplomatic History／Prewar Japanese Diplomatic History [EN]
